pr_title: Create custom theme container for epub renderer [GSoC '23]
pr_body:
## Summary > - Kolibri EPUB renderer currently has 6 fixed built in themes, which are not allowed to be edited by users. Also, Kolibri does not allow adding new color themes to the EPUB renderer with the colors of user's preference. Changes in this PR will bring the ability for the users to add, edit and delete custom color themes for the epub viewer as they prefer. > - User Interfaces : - - **Before** - - - **Current status** - 1.1 Settings side bar in EPUB viewer (Desktop)

1.2 Settings side bar in EPUB viewer (Mobile)

2.1 Add a theme modal (Desktop)

2.2 Add a theme modal (Mobile)

3.1 Select a color using the color picker (Desktop) [CSS to be added]

3.2 Select a color using the color picker (Mobile) [CSS to be added]

## References > - #10741 > - Color picker used : [vue-color](https://github.com/xiaokaike/vue-color) ## Reviewer guidance > Can try the following features > - Adding a new theme by selecting preferred colors for the text and background (link color is not implemented yet) > - Deleting a custom created theme > - Applying a custom created theme to the EPUB viewer > - Editing a custom created theme to change the colors (right now it creates a new theme with the changed colors as the themeName property is not implemented yet) ---- ## Testing checklist - [ ] Contributor has fully tested the PR manually - [ ] If there are any front-end changes, before/after screenshots are included - [ ] Critical user journeys are covered by Gherkin stories - [ ] Critical and brittle code paths are covered by unit tests ## PR process - [ ] PR has the correct target branch and milestone - [ ] PR has 'needs review' or 'work-in-progress' label - [ ] If PR is ready for review, a reviewer has been added. (Don't use 'Assignees') - [ ] If this is an important user-facing change, PR or related issue has a 'changelog' label - [ ] If this includes an internal dependency change, a link to the diff is provided ## Reviewer checklist - Automated test coverage is satisfactory - PR is fully functional - PR has been tested for [accessibility regressions](http://kolibri-dev.readthedocs.io/en/develop/manual_testing.html#accessibility-a11y-testing) - External dependency files were updated if necessary (`yarn` and `pip`) - Documentation is updated - Contributor is in AUTHORS.md

pr_title: Add customized themes feature into EPUB renderer
pr_body:
<!--
 1. Following guidance below, replace …'s with your own words
 2. After saving the PR, tick of completed checklist items
 3. Skip checklist items that are not applicable or not necessary
 4. Delete instruction/comment blocks
-->

## Summary
<!--
 * description of the change
 * manual verification steps performed
 * screenshots if the PR affects the UI
-->

Kolibri EPUB renderer currently has 6 fixed built in themes, which cannot be edited by users. Also, Kolibri does not allow adding new color themes to the EPUB renderer with the colors of user's preference. Changes in this PR will bring the ability for the users to add, edit and delete custom color themes for the epub viewer as they prefer.

## References
<!--
 * references to related issues and PRs
 * links to mockups or specs for new features
 * links to the diffs for any dependency updates, e.g. in iceqube or the perseus plugin
-->

Resolves the issue: #10741 
Color picker used : [Alwan-color-picker](https://github.com/SofianChouaib/alwan)

## Reviewer guidance
<!--
 * how can a reviewer test these changes?
 * are there any risky areas that deserve extra testing
-->

Can try the following features

- Adding a new theme by selecting preferred colors for the text, background, links, and giving it a preferred name
- Deleting a custom created theme
- Applying a custom created theme to the EPUB viewer
- Editing a custom created theme to change the colors and the name

----

## Testing checklist

- [ ] Contributor has fully tested the PR manually
- [ ] If there are any front-end changes, before/after screenshots are included
- [ ] Critical user journeys are covered by Gherkin stories
- [ ] Critical and brittle code paths are covered by unit tests


## PR process

- [ ] PR has the correct target branch and milestone
- [ ] PR has 'needs review' or 'work-in-progress' label
- [ ] If PR is ready for review, a reviewer has been added. (Don't use 'Assignees')
- [ ] If this is an important user-facing change, PR or related issue has a 'changelog' label
- [ ] If this includes an internal dependency change, a link to the diff is provided

## Reviewer checklist

- Automated test coverage is satisfactory
- PR is fully functional
- PR has been tested for [accessibility regressions](http://kolibri-dev.readthedocs.io/en/develop/manual_testing.html#accessibility-a11y-testing)
- External dependency files were updated if necessary (`yarn` and `pip`)
- Documentation is updated
- Contributor is in AUTHORS.md
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1300555713, 'comment_body': 'I think we should convert "This is a link" to a translatable string, and the other text can remain as sample text. 

@radinamatic - what do you think of adding "Sample text" somewhere around the English text? I know we discussed not trying to localize it, but maybe having some information about the purpose could be helpful.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 19, 28, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300556273, 'comment_body': "If you're not using this, let's remove it", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 19, 29, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300563790, 'comment_body': "This is not blocking for this PR, but in your next one, I think there could be some ways to break up the logic of this a little bit, and prevent having to return an empty string, and also reduce some of the computed functions below. Let's put this as a to-do item on your next PR.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 19, 35, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300569026, 'comment_body': '@radinamatic - can you confirm if the aria labels here are being read out properly? I think we might need to do some reconfiguring. Right now, we are passing the string 'backgroundColor' in, but we actually want to translated this. Usually, we use the structure you have here to pass in something like a number. i.e. "Total resources: 15" 

The other thing that we probably will want to change (although Radina can confirm), is that using camel case for strings is not always properly read aloud by screen readers and sometimes can be read out one letter at a time. The function over is fine, but I would recommend passing the option in as an argument (i.e. "backgroundColor") but then using something like a switch or and if/else statement to manage the options, and have one of each, so that you have separate strings such as "Select background color", "Select text color", etc.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 19, 41, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300569493, 'comment_body': 'You could use a pattern like this for the aria-labels in `AddEditCustomThemeModal`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 19, 42, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300599136, 'comment_body': 'For user generated text, we usually wrap the text in quotes. So this (and the others for the other CRUD actions) would be 

"Set custom theme '{themeName}'" (which I think will manage the quotes without needing to escape them)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 20, 11, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777148, 'comment_body': '> convert "This is a link" to a translatable string

This is done,

> adding "Sample text" somewhere around the English text

Waiting for Radina's response', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 54, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777298, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 54, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777475, 'comment_body': 'Sure, reason to return the empty string in some functions is that a linter rule prompts an error when there is no return outside of an if clause. We will refactor this part later.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 54, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777549, 'comment_body': "I refactored the code here, now it uses the translatable strings for 'Background', 'Text', and 'Links', which we already have in the code. And got rid of the `generateSelectColorAriaLabel` function and referred directly to the `select` translatable text.

Please confirm if there is any issue now", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 54, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777735, 'comment_body': 'i guess this is sorted now, refer to my reply in last comment.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1302777936, 'comment_body': 'done. applied for set, delete, and edit theme strings.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 9, 55, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1303059091, 'comment_body': "Thanks - I'll wait for @radinamatic's confirmation that on the accessibility side, this is good 👍 ", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 13, 52, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1303060053, 'comment_body': 'I'm still seeing the commented out code
`<!-- @submit="setThemeColor($event)" -->`
here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 23, 13, 53, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1306773522, 'comment_body': "Agreed on making _This is a link_ translatable (thank you, Akila), but I'm not sure I understand the 'Sample text' bit thing, @marcellamaki ...? 🤔 Where exactly are you suggesting we put it?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 28, 0, 45, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'radinamatic', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1307004407, 'comment_body': 'I did not notice any issues in the way the labels for these 3 buttons are read by the screen reader during the latest testing, we should be good! 👍🏽 ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 28, 7, 14, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'radinamatic', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1307782894, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 28, 18, 46, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1307827209, 'comment_body': "Hi @Akila-I - after some chatting with @radinamatic, I think this function will be too complicated for localization purposes (even though it does present the correct text). It will be a bit tricky to explain to translators how to properly managed this through the platform we use. Instead of using a function here, let's just add the extra strings:
'Select link color', 'Select background color', etc. 
And reference them directly", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 28, 19, 37, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1308195522, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 29, 4, 57, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Epub viewer settings side bar redesigned
pr_body:
<!--
 1. Following guidance below, replace …'s with your own words
 2. After saving the PR, tick of completed checklist items
 3. Skip checklist items that are not applicable or not necessary
 4. Delete instruction/comment blocks
-->

## Summary
<!--
 * description of the change
 * manual verification steps performed
 * screenshots if the PR affects the UI
-->

With the user customized themes introduced in the epub viewer, the name of the themes is identified as an important attribute to be showed to the user. Also the compact view of the DELETE and EDIT buttons associated with each custom theme makes the settings side bar UI look overpopulated with items in it.

This PR refers to the designs from the Kolibri design team. As the first step of implementing the new design, The settings side bar view is modified to give user a simple and intuitive set of items to navigate through.

Also the focus management in the Modals to select different colors for the themes is implemented as well.

This PR is followed by the changes introduced in #11041 .

### Screenshots
- Before (Desktop view)
![image](https://github.com/learningequality/kolibri/assets/80597937/7a2dc866-239c-4226-aceb-16b0ee21d237)

- After (Desktop view)
![image](https://github.com/learningequality/kolibri/assets/80597937/7bb43de7-03f8-4f3e-b5d9-b2cdc918df80)

- Before (Mobile view)
![image](https://github.com/learningequality/kolibri/assets/80597937/e006976b-44d0-4ecc-b695-bc2d1bbfa859)

- After (Mobile view)
![image](https://github.com/learningequality/kolibri/assets/80597937/3916bd3e-4bf4-4506-b9dd-400c0345c905)

## References
<!--
 * references to related issues and PRs
 * links to mockups or specs for new features
 * links to the diffs for any dependency updates, e.g. in iceqube or the perseus plugin
-->

Figma design for the new EPUB viewer settings : https://www.figma.com/file/zpwcUcGR8D0hKUGvZU8kf3/Enhanced-EPUB-Renderer?type=design&node-id=0%3A1&mode=design&t=CgU7rA96zHncjSwZ-1


## Reviewer guidance
<!--
 * how can a reviewer test these changes?
 * are there any risky areas that deserve extra testing
-->

Followings can be experienced in reviewing:
- Focus management of the Modals
- New Settings SideBar view

---

## Testing checklist

- [ ] Contributor has fully tested the PR manually
- [ ] If there are any front-end changes, before/after screenshots are included
- [ ] Critical user journeys are covered by Gherkin stories
- [ ] Critical and brittle code paths are covered by unit tests


## PR process

- [ ] PR has the correct target branch and milestone
- [ ] PR has 'needs review' or 'work-in-progress' label
- [ ] If PR is ready for review, a reviewer has been added. (Don't use 'Assignees')
- [ ] If this is an important user-facing change, PR or related issue has a 'changelog' label
- [ ] If this includes an internal dependency change, a link to the diff is provided

## Reviewer checklist

- Automated test coverage is satisfactory
- PR is fully functional
- PR has been tested for [accessibility regressions](http://kolibri-dev.readthedocs.io/en/develop/manual_testing.html#accessibility-a11y-testing)
- External dependency files were updated if necessary (`yarn` and `pip`)
- Documentation is updated
- Contributor is in AUTHORS.md
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 1317596218, 'comment_body': "I think you might get an error, or at least a warning, here, if you don't have a return value that's not in an 'if' statement. You may need to add a default `else`", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 17, 9, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1317599834, 'comment_body': 'Does this work in RTL languages? i.e. Arabic? We do have some handling for flipping lefts and rights with styling, but it might require using a class here, not just adding the style like this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 17, 12, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1317603248, 'comment_body': 'Let's have this as "Themes & settings" and use styling to make it all caps in the UI, if we need to. Generally we don't use all caps, but if it's in the spec, we can for now. But, we are moving away from this pattern (i.e. with our buttons, etc.) so it would be good to use sentence case and have the flexibility in the future', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 17, 16, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1317605946, 'comment_body': 'We do sometimes use style like this, but for these, which are relatively straightforward and are not dependent on things like computed values, let's put them in a class. If there's only one value (i.e. "padding: 0"), it's okay to leave it as an inline `style`, but I think once we get to three or so items here, it's easier to read if it's a class.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 17, 19, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marcellamaki', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1317637027, 'comment_body': 'Good 👁️ @marcellamaki , I missed this completely! Yes, please, we need to steer away from all caps!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 17, 49, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'radinamatic', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1317648960, 'comment_body': "I'm also now thinking we don't really need the new string 'Themes & settings', let's just keep it at 'Settings'. 

And the H3 should be 'Theme**s**', in plural:

![2023-09-06_19-57-35](https://github.com/learningequality/kolibri/assets/1457929/7ec1c2ff-f24f-45de-bd56-4fbbccffeadf)
", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 6, 18, 1, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'radinamatic', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318084067, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 5, 0, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318084139, 'comment_body': 'Its only the top margin of the entire div, which is a row displayed in the settings sidebar. I will put it into a class anyway.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 5, 0, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318084183, 'comment_body': "- 'THEMES & SETTINGS' is changed to 'Settings'
- 'Theme' is changed to 'Default themes'", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 5, 0, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318084623, 'comment_body': 'done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 5, 1, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318213080, 'comment_body': "I'm sorry, probably should have mentioned that: even though we have a few instances of the word 'Default' in Kolibri UI, we decided to restrict them to the admin pages, and not use them in the learner view to keep the language and terminology as simple and readable as possible. Just 'Themes' should be OK.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 7, 41, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'radinamatic', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1318251889, 'comment_body': 'Oh okay. Thanks for the update. will do that :) ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 7, 8, 15, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'Akila-I', 'type': 'User'}]
